value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported but will be sent without a message body.
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Response Body In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.
value.name: Digest Authentication

value.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.
value.name: Always Output Response

value.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.
value.name: Trusted Hostname

value.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.
value.name: Add Response Headers to Request

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.
The <Partition> property will be used to determine the partition. All messages within the same FlowFile will be assigned to the same partition.

value.description: Specifies how messages should be partitioned when sent to Kafka
value.name: Partition Strategy

value.description: Specifies which Kafka Partition to add the message to. If using a message delimiter, all messages in the same FlowFile will be sent to the same partition. If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.
value.name: Partition

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size that any individual record can be.
value.name: Max Record Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: The number of messages to send in one batch. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Maximum time to buffer data before sending to Kafka. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100 milliseconds' worth of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.
Compress messages using GZIP
Compress messages using Snappy

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

value.description: Specifies the value for 'Producer Type' Kafka Configuration.
value.name: Producer Type

value.description: Specifies the value for 'Queue Buffer Max Count' Kafka Configuration.
value.name: Queue Buffer Max Count

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.

If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.

If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.

value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.
Compress messages using GZIP
Compress messages using Snappy

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.name: Client Name

value.name: Producer Type

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A SolrCloud instance.
A stand-alone Solr instance.

value.description: The type of Solr instance, Cloud or Standard.
value.name: Solr Type

value.description: The Solr url for a Solr Type of Standard (ex: http://localhost:8984/solr/gettingstarted), or the ZooKeeper hosts for a Solr Type of Cloud (ex: localhost:9983).
value.name: Solr Location

value.description: The Solr collection name, only used with a Solr Type of Cloud
value.name: Collection

value.description: The path in Solr to post the ContentStream
value.name: Content Stream Path

value.description: Content-Type being sent to Solr
value.name: Content-Type

value.description: The number of milliseconds before the given update is committed
value.name: Commit Within

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'event_timestamp' request parameter
value.name: event_timestamp

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'event_timestamp_dt' request parameter
value.name: event_timestamp_dt

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed because Solr is unreachable
relationships.name: connection_failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed for any reason other than Solr being unreachable
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile
relationships.name: success

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

entry.key: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of HTTP Headers that should be passed along as FlowFile attributes
value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)
value.name: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second
HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

relationships.description: Relationship for successfully received FlowFiles
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

entry.value: id, deviceId_s, channel_i, program_s, network_s, eventTimeStamp_l,gmtOffset_i,longTimeStamp_l,market_s,zipCode_i, event_dt, state_s

relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

entry.key: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of HTTP Headers that should be passed along as FlowFile attributes
value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)
value.name: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.name: Destination
